intro: Cremanium compressum, commonly known as the narrowleaf cremanium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically bright yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
